criteria: Ability to decompose numbers less than or equal to 10
Representation of decomposition using drawings or equations
descriptions: Student is unable to decompose numbers or shows no understanding of the concept.
Student attempts to decompose numbers but struggles to find correct pairs. Demonstrates limited understanding.
Student can decompose numbers into pairs but only finds one or two ways. Shows basic understanding.
Student decomposes numbers into multiple pairs with some accuracy. Shows a good understanding of the concept.
Student decomposes numbers into various pairs accurately and efficiently. Demonstrates a strong understanding.
Student decomposes numbers into all possible pairs accurately, efficiently, and can explain the concept clearly. Shows mastery of the concept.
Student does not attempt to represent the decomposition using drawings or equations.
Student attempts to represent the decomposition but struggles with accuracy or clarity.
Student represents the decomposition using drawings or equations with some inaccuracies or lack of clarity.
Student accurately represents the decomposition using drawings or equations. The representation is clear and understandable.
Student accurately represents the decomposition using drawings and equations. The representation is clear, efficient, and well-organized.
Student accurately and creatively represents the decomposition using drawings and equations. The representation is exceptionally clear, efficient, and demonstrates deep understanding.
